TopicTitle: Trying to get 64 to run with mods ... but cant seem too get anything too ever work

Articles.Content:
Been trying for A week not too run KSP 64 W/ Mods ... keep having crashes. Mostly clicking on parts in VAB or going to Load A ship.

Am running KSP 64 exe, I am sure I installed all the Mods right. I have Uninstalled and reinstalled KSP and few times, re-downloaded the mods ect ect.

Unity Player [version: Unity 4.5.2f1_9abb1b59b47c]

KSP Windows x64 is not a stable release. SQUAD warned us this might be the case, and boy is it true. If you want working 64bit, use the linux version.

x64's stability depends on nothing other than your luck. I have 66 mods as of now (mostly Realism Overhaul mods) and I encounter the occasional problem that probably wouldn't be there with x86, but mostly everything's working as supposed to. I don't have any incompatibility issues. Bad luck seems to be the only explanation to stories like yours.

So the only fix for your problem I can think of is to find a few 4-leaf clovers.

Edited August 25, 2014 by xrayfishx

It's not luck per se. It's also that win x64 has some serious memory-related and exception-handling-related issues. We can get it to crash on demand (when 32bit will be fine under the same circumstances).

I had similar problems. What got it working for me was forcing the game to run on OpenGL. There's a thread on how to do this here (http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/84203).

Good luck mate
